newsitem.title: USA: Wisconsin Electric nuclear plants to restart.
newsitem.headline: Wisconsin Electric nuclear plants to restart.

text.p: Wisconsin Electric, owner and operator of a facility that provides one-sixth of the state's electricity, said that both units of its Point Beach Nuclear Plant should be returned to service by mid-July,

According to new estimates, Unit 2 should be returned to service on or about June 25. It has been out of service since October 1996 for refueling, replacement of its steam generators and additional maintenance.

Unit 1 should be returned to service on or about July 18. Unit 1 was taken out of service for unscheduled maintenance on February 18 and ready to return to service in March, but kept off line since it was scheduled for a refueling outage in May.
It will return to service in July when electricity demand is highest and will go off line for refueling in September.
Wisconsin Electric, a subsidiary of Wisconsin Energy Corp, provides electricity, natural gas and/or steam service to about 2.3 million people in parts of Wisconsin and Michigan.
